lexUnit.name: chuckle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a quiet or suppressed laugh.

sentence.text: For a long time Mait did n't answer , until a low chuckle gradually worked its way from his throat .
Dexter ignored her friendly chuckle and explained the reasons why he thought Jim Lancaster was the prime suspect , counting off the points on his fingers .
She took a deep breath , letting it out on a low , pleasurable chuckle as she headed for the stage .
Before she could say anything , however , she was astonished to hear Joanna 's attractive chuckle as she turned and indicated Ian Woodall .
Merry gave a little chuckle as Shannon rolled her eyes heavenwards .
He gave a chuckle which sounded almost like the other
She heard his soft and sensuous chuckle float on the moonbeams behind her .
The smell of the peat , gurgle of water racing over boulders and chuckle of flocks of fieldfares searching for mountain ash berries are as characteristic as the scenery itself .
The bubbling , watery chuckle of the river .
Melissa strolled across , leaned against Iris 's fence and closed her eyes , listening to the bleating of young lambs and the chuckle of a solitary starling on the roof .
Chuckles of delight greeted his suggestion that ` as the Microsoft monopoly puts programmers out of business they can move to writing objectware for NeXT . "
Do I detect that narrowing of the eyes , a dark glimmer , a deep throated chuckle at the thought of this beast ?
A story which I heard from Dad about his days at Charlton-All-Saints brought a chuckle from him as he told it but , at the time , the occasion must have been almost tragic .
Even while she was speaking , the theory sounded bizarre and far-fetched , yet there were no more quips or chuckles from the other end of the line , only a series of grunts .
The gentle quip brought a chuckle from the journalists and put Urquhart firmly in control .
It certainly brought a chuckle from my lips .
His father gave a rare chuckle .
Rose gave a gleeful chuckle .
` No , Farquhar , " he said with a bitter chuckle .
He emitted one of his painful-sounding nasal chuckles .
He gave a feeble chuckle , and clutched his ribs with his left hand .
Her friend 's face wrinkled in one of her famous chuckles .
